DOC.brief_summary: Aim study . To evaluate L. reuteri DSM 17938 supplementation since first day life reduce onset gaseous colic neonate onset minor digestive disorder regurgitation constipation . Study Design . Double blind , randomize , control , multicenter study . 492 neonate 37-42 gestational age , breast formula feed , receive L. reuteri 5 drop ( 1x108 CFU ) daily placebo 28 day . After inclusion , baseline perform : - Paediatric visit - antropometric valutation - number daily cry minute , number regurgitation number daily evacuation The patient receive probiotics/placebo every day 28 day 29th repeat follow analysis : - Paediatric visit - antropometric valutation - number daily cry minute - number regurgitation - number evacuation Primary outcome : To define Lactobacillus reuteri supplementation reduce onset gaseous colic , regurgitation constipation . Inclusion criterion - neonate 37-42 week gestational age appropriate birth weight - Recruitment age : 7 day life - Informed consent sign Exclusion criterion - Presence gastrointestinal disease . - Use FANS , aspirin drug - Use antibiotic and/or PPIs e/o anti-H2 - Participation clinical trial
